p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: Liberty Center Parents, Students and Community:

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: Yesterday, Governor DeWine announced that schools will now be closed through May 1, 2020. While this provides some challenges, our Administrative Team and staff have been preparing for this possibility. I want to assure you we are working diligently to continue educating the students of Liberty Center.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: As we move forward during this unprecedented time, we thank you for your understanding and patience. We know there are challenges and difficulties unique to each individual family. Please continue to communicate with teachers and principals. We are here to help you and your child navigate the distance learning process.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: There are many questions regarding a wide array of school functions and activities. All school-sponsored events are postponed until this order is lifted. We will continue to do our best with providing answers as they are provided by the Ohio Department of Education and Governor DeWine.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.span: We understand this is a trying and stressful time for everyone. Please remember we are here to help.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: Football Restroom and Concession Facility Groundbreaking

div.h2: Welcome to Liberty Center Local Schools

div.p: Liberty Center Local Schools currently serves approximately 1,200 pre-school through 12th-grade students in Henry County as well as a small portion of Fulton County. The district currently operates 3 buildings, Liberty Center Elementary school, serving grades PK-4; Liberty Center Middle School, serving grades 5-8, and Liberty Center High School, serving grades 9-12.Our district offers a variety of co-curricular and extra-curricular activities designed to provide choices for all students to take an active part in the educational process.Vocational education services are provided through affiliation with the Four County Career Center located in Archbold, Ohio.

Through the collaborative efforts of the Ohio Facilities Construction Commission and the Ohio School Facilities Commission, the district is involved in a $42.6 million, PK-12 construction project. The building was completed in December, 2017, with the total project completed in August 2018.
